channel.title: Articles by Adam Sabin on Tech Terminologies
channel.description: Recent content in Articles by Adam Sabin on Tech Terminologies

item.title: What is a GUI (Graphical User Interface)?
item.description: A GUI, or Graphical User Interface, is a type of interface that allows users to interact with electronic devices through visual elements such as icons and graphics, rather than typing commands in a command-line interface.

item.title: What is Garbage Collection?
item.description: Garbage collection is a fundamental concept in computer science, particularly in the field of programming languages.

item.title: What is an Application?
item.description: An application, or application program, is a software program designed to perform a specific task or set of tasks.

item.title: What is Grid Computing?
item.description: Grid computing is a distributed computing paradigm that involves the use of a large number of computers to solve complex problems or perform large-scale data processing tasks.

item.title: What is Cyberbullying?
item.description: Cyberbullying is the use of technology to harass, threaten, or intimidate someone, often repeatedly.

item.title: What is 3G?
item.description: 3G, or third generation, is a generation of wireless mobile telecommunications technology.

item.title: What is User Identification?
item.description: User identification is the process of identifying and authenticating a user’s identity in order to grant them access to a system or service.

item.title: What is a Home Page?
item.description: A home page is the main or front page of a website.

item.title: What is Golden Master?
item.description: A “golden master,” also known as a “golden image” or “golden copy,” is the final version of a software product that has been thoroughly tested and approved for release.

item.title: What is a Digital Signature?
item.description: A digital signature is a form of electronic signature that uses a combination of cryptography and authentication to provide a secure way of verifying the identity of the sender of an electronic document and the integrity of the document itself.

item.title: What is Access (Microsoft Access)?
item.description: Microsoft Access is a database management system (DBMS) that is part of the Microsoft Office suite of productivity software.

item.title: What is Bare Metal?
item.description: A bare metal system is a computer that does not include an operating system or any other software, so the user must install an operating system in order to use the hardware.
